MILITARY REIMBURSEMENTS. The military provides active-duty personnel a reimbursement for most one-time adoption costs, up to $2,000 per child. The maximum amount available in a given year is $5,000, even if both parents are in the military. Reimbursement is made after the adoption is finalized.

For on-going assistance (per diems) the amount is calculated based on family income and size. The maximum is half the daily maintenance rate for foster care. On Friday, Indiana Department of Child Services released a new foster care per diem rate schedule. The reimbursements become effective January 1, 2012. With the new rates, the needs of the child and their age, rather than the licensing level of the foster home, will determine the rate at which foster parents are reimbursed. Back in 2009, DCS announced that they planned to drop the amount foster parents got daily per child from $25 to $22.50.

The Per Diem Allowance. Each year the DoD Per Diem, Travel and Transportation Committee sets the Per Diem allowance.
